dialogues.text: Nicole sits in front of the TV, working on her video proj Harvey passes through.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Don’t ever look up to your brother, Nicole. He’s a bad seed. A bad, bad seed.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. He’s gonna buy me Rock Band for the Wii.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Are materialistic things really that important to you?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Look who’s talking. At least Hutch keeps his word. (re: video) Are you ever going to help me with this thing?  63.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Once I finish up this presentation for work. I’m under a lot of pressure right now.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Blah, blah, blah. How ‘bout coming up with a new story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn’s prepping dinner. Harvey enters.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: We better watch out, Mare, that girl’s headed down the same path as her brother.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Wouldn't that be great? Two Vice- Presidents in the same family.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Lighten up, Harv. He looks over to the stove.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna make it to dinner tonight. I’m on a big deadline for work and Phil’s coming over. Could be an all nighter.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: I’m actually making this for Hutch. He’s having dinner-

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Stop. I don’t want to hear it. I know it’1l just upset me.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Harvey... He heads off.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I‘’1l be out in the garage. Send Phil back.  64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - A giant blue badger head. Phil inspects the head. Harvey is dressed in the rest of costume.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, it looks like a giant rat head.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Will you stop. Trust me on this, Phil. Spudz McKenzie, the Budweiser frogs, they sell product.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: The Hibrau Badgers?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Badgers are from Wisconsin, they’re funny and the demographic we're going after loves ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Why blue?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It seems kind of ridiculous. He grabs the badger head from Phil and puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Check this out. Harvey heads over to the refrigerator, but has a hard tim navigating all the clutter. He mutters to himself, but ca barely be understood through the giant foam head.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (muffled) I’ve told that kid a thousand times to clean this garage.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: What’s that, Harv?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Nothing.  65. He gets to the fridge and pulls out a six-pack of Hibrau. Holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: “Hibrau Lager, for the badger in all of us.” Phil stares at him for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Forget the copy. The badger is funny, right?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You’re not selling me here.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You need to think outside the box. Come on, put yours on and we’ll get a second opinion from Marilyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON - Hutch sits at the feast-filled dining room tab telling a story.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And then my buddy Warburton says, “You really want it, officer? Then come pull it out of my ass.” REVEAL - BRACKEN sits at the other end of the table. He almost chokes on his drink, then bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Son, that could be one of the greatest stories I’ve ever heard!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I got a ton of ‘em, sir. Bracken leans back with a full belly.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: That meatloaf was superb. And those potatoes, out of this world.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That Marilyn, she can cook.  66.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: I’ve got to tell you, Hutch, you’ve brought a new spark to this company.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I do what I do, sir. Another brandy, Mr. Bracken?

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Don’t mind if I do. And it’s high time you call me Arthur. Hutch fills Bracken’s glass then raises his.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Cheers to you, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Phil, both dressed in the badger costumes, ent through the screen door.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I feel like an idiot in this thing.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Will you stop? Harvey pushes through the swinging door AND SEES BRACKEN SITTING AT THE DINING ROOM TABLE. He backs into the kitchen, KNOCKING INTO PHIL. They both CRASH TO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Hey! What the hell- Harvey puts his hand over the mouth of Phil’s badger head

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Shhhh! Oh my God. Bracken.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: He’s sitting at my dining room table.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: You're kidding me?  67.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Hutch, that little brown nose. (beat) Come on. We can’t let Bracken see us like this. They turn to sneak out the screen door, but Hutch and Bra are now STANDING OUT BY THE POOL. Bracken offers Hutch a cigar and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Crap! We’re going to have go through the front and around. They push through the kitchen and into...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where RACHAEL RAY POPS UP from the couch. She GROWLS at t

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Quiet, Rachael Ray! It’s me, your master. She BARKS. Her eyes go bug-eyed, freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Phil, grab me some scraps from the table. Harvey reaches his hand back, keeping his eyes on Rachael as Phil hands him the ENTIRE MEATLOAF.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (realizing) I said scraps, not the whole- Too late. Rachael Ray rushes Harvey and SNATCHES the meatloaf.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What part of “scraps” didn't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: That dog is psycho. Rachael Ray guards the meatloaf. She becomes more aggress BARKING at Harvey and Phil.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Give me that bottle of Brandy.  68.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I'm thinking this is not the right time for drinks.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Just hand me the bottle, please. Phil hands it to him. Harvey pours a few drops in his pal and holds it out to Rachael Ray.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Come here, girl. Rachael Ray calms down. She comes over to Harvey and laps the Brandy from his palm.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s it, Rachael Ray. Good dog- Rachael Ray LUNGES at Harvey’s other hand and grabs the brandy bottle. She darts up the stairs with it in her mou

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That takes care of that.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Impressive. Harvey and Phil continue to the front door. As Harvey reaches for the handle, the door opens and NICO ENTERS. She SCREAMS, having no idea it’s Harvey and Phil. They struggle to take off their badger heads.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: Nicole reaches into her pack back...

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (mumbling through costume) Calm down! It’s me- ...and WHIPS OUT A CAN OF PEPPER SPRAY, SPRAYING THEM THR THE OPENINGS IN THE BADGER HEADS.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: OOWWWW! Stop-  69. Nicole dodges past them. She PUSHES them out the door and SLAMS it SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Phil TUMBLE onto the front lawn, ROLLING AROUN BLINDED. They finally get the badger heads off.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: It burns! Harvey grabs the garden hose. He DOUSES Phil’s face, then own. They lay back, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: I told you this was a bad idea! From the other side of the fence they hear...

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m hoping the boys in marketing are going to knock our socks off next week with the new ideas.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’ve been on top of them, Arthur.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Hide! Harvey and Phil SCRAMBLE INTO THE BUSHES as Bracken and H come through the side gate.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Speaking of ideas, Arthur, are you familiar with NASCAR?

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: The car racing?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Fastest growing sport in the world, and the perfect opportunity to nail the younger demographic. I’m thinking it’s where we should be.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Interesting. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BUSHES
dialogues.text: Harvey and Phil listen.  70.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: As fate would have it, they’re racing here this weekend at the Speedway. The Milwaukee 500. I'd like to do a little research.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You have my blessing. Whatever you need.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Arthur. RACHAEL RAY, with blood shot eyes, STUMBLES out of the ho She has the empty brandy bottle in her mouth. Rachael Ray sniffs the air, locking onto a scent. She dro the brandy bottle and RUNS TOWARD THE BUSHES. HARVEY watches as Rachael Ray beelines for the bushes. Sh stumbles, face-plants, then gets up and darts toward them

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Crap. Rachael Ray reaches the bushes. She bares her teeth and begins BARKING WITH A SLUR.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Rachael Ray, shoo. Get away. HUTCH notices Rachael Ray barking drunkenly at the bushes

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What is it, Rachael Ray? Rachael Ray is going NUTS, FOAMING AT THE MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Might be a rabbit in there. Rachael Ray DIVES INTO THE BUSHES and... ATTACKS Harvey and Phil. BITING, CLAWING, SCRATCHING. The put the badger heads back on for protection. Rachael Ray mounts Harvey’s face. She looks Harvey in his badger eyes...AND PUKES INTO THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachael Ray leaps onto Phil.

dialogues.speaker: HEEEEEELP
dialogues.text: They SPRING FROM THE BUSHES in a panic, REVEALING THEMSEL

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: What in God’s name!? Hutch contains his laughter, knowing it’s Harvey and Phil

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: There’s been reported robberies in the neighborhood, sir. Media's coined them the “Rat Bandits”.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Not on my watch! Bracken grabs the rake off the lawn and BEATS ON THE BADG as Rachael Ray continues her attack.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: (with each beat of the rake) NOBODY-STEALS-FROM-MY-EMPLOYEES. Harvey and Phil FLAIL under Bracken’s beating. As they tr run away... Bracken throws the rake at them and it gets caught up in Phil's feet, tripping him. Harvey helps him up and they t off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Don’t think you'll be having a problem with them anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. You’re a hero to the neighborhood. Rachael Ray looks up at them...HICCUPS.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That’s a good girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch is kicked back watching TV. Harvey enters, battered bruised from the badger ordeal.  72.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hey Harv, you don’t look so good. What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Real funny, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Well you gotta admit it’s kind of funny. But no worries, I didn’t blow your cover and I convinced Mom not to call the cops.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well now my badger presentation’s blown.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Look at it as me saving you from embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You think you know it all, don’t you? Harvey turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I was sort of watching that.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Well you’re not watching it anymore. I want the garage cleaned out, and take out the garbage then straighten up your room!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Harv, let’s take it down a notch.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’M NOT HARV. I’M YOUR FATHER. AND AROUND HERE I’M STILL THE BOSS! YOU

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What’s your problem?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What’s my problem? I’1l tell you what my problem is. You have a job you don’t deserve and you think this is all one big joke.  73.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Wow. And jealousy rears its ugly head.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Jealous? Because you do nothing, make six figures and that nut job Bracken thinks you’re the second coming?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Did you ever think that maybe I’m good at what I’m doing and I’m actually making a difference? Or is it all just a big coincidence that Hibrau is kicking ass?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m going to go with coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: This is the guy in the rat suit talking? Real creative stuff, pops.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: We're done with this conversation.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Maybe I’m not done.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: My house, my rules. You don’t like it? Too bad. Now get that room cleaned before I ground you for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey exits his bedroom dressed for work. He hears a VAC coming from Hutch’s room.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Damn right I’m in charge. This is my house. He walks by Hutch’s bedroom and sees a MAID, vigorously cleaning with the vacuum. HE BOILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn and Nicole make breakfast. Harvey rushes in.  74.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that cleaning Hutch’s bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: That’s Ester. Hutch hired her. Harvey drops his head into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Hutch moved out, Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What do you mean he moved out?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: He said he wanted to try living on his own, by his rules.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Oh he did, did he? That’s what he said?

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: His exact words were, “Dad is acting like an a-hole. I’m outta here.”

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Nicole!

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Well, that’s what he said.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Thinks he can one up me, does he?

dialogues.speaker: WHERE DID HE GO
dialogues.text: INT. HUTCH’S DOWNTOWN LOFT - DAY Teddy takes in the spacious, upscale loft.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Unbelievable. This place is sick! Hutch directs a Best Buy delivery guy.  75.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: The 65 inch goes in the master and let's hang the 110 inch bad boy over the fire place.

dialogues.speaker: BEST BUY GUY
dialogues.text: No problem. Another delivery guy enters with a full size SLURPEE MACH

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You can hook that sucker up behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Ever have a beer slurpee, Ted-0?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Pure genius. An AIR HORN blasts from the street below.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Our ride is here. Teddy goes to the window, looks out. His eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: No way. EXT. HUTCH’S LOFT - DAY Hutch greets a teamster driver, CARMINE, as he jumps out the cab of the HIBRAU MOBILE BAR TRUCK. The side of the t been repainted: “Hibrau, The number one choice of real NA fans.”

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Carmine!

dialogues.speaker: CARMINE
dialogues.text: Yo boss, we ready to roll?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Ready to go to the races, Ted-0O? Teddy looks at him with disbelief.  76.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: If you tell me we’re going to the Milwaukee 500, I’m gonna crap my pants. If you tell me where going to the Milwaukee 500 in that truck, I’m gonna crap your pants.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Then we’ll stop for diapers on the way. Bracken let me pull it from the Milwaukee Fall Festival.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Sick! Teddy looks at Hutch. Hugs him. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Let’s move her out, Carmine.

dialogues.speaker: CARMINE
dialogues.text: You’re the boss, boss.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: FIFTY-THOUSAND RABID RACE FANS fill the grandstands aroun the speedway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with hundreds of RV’s, corporate tents and concessions. The Hibrau truck, which is now converted into a bar, is s up right behind pit row. Best seats in the house. Warburton and Riley help Carmine serve free beer to a SMA CROWD as Hutch and Teddy sit in lounge chairs checking ou the teams prepping for the race.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dude, if I die right here, today, I’m good with it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Check it out, there’s Tony Stewart. And over there, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Hutch spots his idol, the squeaky clean NASCAR darling, J GORDON.  77.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Yo, Gordo! Today’s your day! JEFF GORDON looks over to Hutch and gives him the thumbs

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Did you see that? Wonder Boy just gave you props.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That’s my main man right there. Hutch calls over to the beer truck.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Riley! How we doin’? Riley is surrounded by HOT CHICKS as he serves them beer.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: This doesn’t suck! Warburton tosses out Hibrau t-shirts between pours.

dialogues.speaker: HOT CHICK
dialogues.text: Like, how do I get one of those shirts?

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: You take the one you have on, off. She does. Then shakes her tits and gives a little giggle. Warburton gives Riley a wink.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Give me some of those shirts! He hands him a stack.

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: Remember, Hutch said we don’t give these to fat chicks. Got it? Hutch gets up from the lounge chair.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Remember, people! This is all compliments from your friends over at Hibrau! “The number one choice of real NASCAR fans.” Hutch raises his beer cup.  78.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hibrau rocks! Hibrau rocks! The crowd joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hibrau party has swelled to a thousand plus. This is place to be. Hutch and his boys sit on top of the truck w a group of hot girls all sporting Hibrau tank tops. They whoop it up for Jeff Gordon, who’s in the lead, head for the checkered flag.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Bring it, Gordo! Bring it!

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: He’s got it! Gordon crosses the finish line. Winner.

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: Okay ladies, shirts up for Mr. Gordon! The girls LIFT THEIR TANK TOPS, saluting Jeff Gordon. EXT. MILWAUKEE MILE SPEEDWAY - WINNER’S CIRCLE Jeff Gordon and his team are up on the podium celebrating their victory. Jeff chugs the ceremonial bottle of milk. REVEAL - Hutch has somehow worked his way into the middle the celebration. He holds up a Hibrau beer can in victory grabs Jeff's arm and raises it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Jeff Gordon, a true champion! Everyone goes nuts. Jeff goes with it then leans over to Hutch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: I don’t know who you are, kid, but I like your style.  79.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’m just an impressionable young lad who looks up to you as role model, Mr. Gordon. Hutch grins, presents him with a business card.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hutch Hutchinson, Vice President, Hibrau Brewing Company. Me and the boys would like to invite you to my little house warming party tonight. It’ll be off the hook. Guaranteed. He hands Jeff the can of Hibrau.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Address is written on the can. Hope you can make it. Hutch fist bumps Jeff and takes off, leaving him dumbfoun Jeff looks at the can.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Hey Jeff, over here! Jeff turns to the Photographer.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Hold up the can! Jeff does so awkwardly. The camera goes SNAP, SNAP. Photographer turns to Hutch who tosses him a Hibrau t-shi EXT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT The Hibrau truck is parked in front. We FOLLOW the beer t lines that run out of the truck and up the side of the building and into... INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT ...the BAR in Hutch’s loft where Carmine mixes Hibrau Slurpees. The party from the raceway is now packed into Hutch’s place. DUDES are partying, GIRLS are going wild and a LIVE BAND rocks the house.  80. In the middle of the make-shift dance floor Hutch grinds out with a HOTTIE. Teddy, Warburton and Riley egg on Hutc into some dirty dancing.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Tear it up, dude! Own that ass! Hutch actually has some moves. He spins, krumps, etc., as onlookers cheer him on. The song ends and the place erupts.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Hutch, you are the king!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: His majesty needs a refill on ye ‘ol Hibrau. As they head over to the bar... JEFF GORDON and his PIT CREW enter through the front door

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Gordo! Wow! Glad you could make it. Jeff Gordon looks around.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Great set up.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Thanks. This is Teddy, Riley and Warburton.

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: Frickin’ awesome!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you guys. This is my pit crew. They exchange hellos.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Welcome, guys. Make yourself at home. How ‘bout some cold refreshing Hibrau?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: I’m not much of drinker. You have any milk? Hutch leads him to the bar.  81.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: C'mon. One beer won't kill ya. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - LATER Hutch is working the party. He passes a group of girls.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Having a good time, ladies? Remember, “Girls who drink Hibrau are prettier than girls who don’t.” They look at him like he makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: Hell yeah! Awesome! He strolls over to the BAR where Jeff Gordon is POUNDING BEERS with his pit crew.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Not much of a drinker, huh, Gordo? Jeff Gordon has transformed from goody, goody Jekyll to p monster Hyde.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Wooo! This party is insane! YEAH!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: There ya go. That’s the Hibrau spirit- Jeff Gordon GRABS a bowl of peanuts off the bar, dumps it his mouth like he’s slurping soup.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Looks like someone’s a little hungry.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Hungry like the wolf, bitch! Jeff Gordon leans into Hutch. Whispers...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Let’s get it on. Hutch is a little creeped, not sure what he means.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Chicks, brother. Wonder Boy needs some tail!  82.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Oh. Not a problem. Hutch WHISTLES over to a BLONDE on the couch. Gestures fo her to come over. She does.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Katie, this is Jeff- Jeff Gordon GRABS HER. BLASTS his tongue into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: WONDER BOY LIKEY
dialogues.text: Katie SLAPS him.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: What the hell, dude? Jeff Gordon grabs his cheek. Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Wonder Boy likey, a lot. Katie storms off.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Uh, Gordo, you’re like red-lining here. Maybe down shift a gear or two? Jeff Gordon's focus is across the room where Teddy, Riley Warburton play NASCAR ‘09 on the 110 inch plasma.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: You race?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Do I race? I’m like unbeatable.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Then maybe you should stop acting like a little pussy and get ready to take an ass beating.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You don’t want to go there, Gordo. Jeff Gordon drains his beer then stares down Hutch.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: My picture’s on the God damn game box.  83.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Let’s do this. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - MOMENTS LATER The entire party gathers around Hutch and Jeff Gordon as get ready to duel it out in NASCAR ‘09. Hutch does warm-up taps on his controller. Jeff Gordon ge stretched out by his pit crew. Riley holds up a Hibrau t-shirt as a starting flag.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Racer’s on your mark...Set...Go! Hutch and Jeff Gordon hit their controllers, taking off i their virtual cars to the CHEERS of the crowd. The go neck and neck through the first lap.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Looks like someone's played this before.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I can race this mother in my sleep. As they come around the turn Jeff Gordon pulls into the l

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah? Don’t forget who consulted on this thing. Hutch quick taps his controller and tries to go inside. J Gordon blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: Rookie move, bitch. Hutch executes a series of COMPLICATED TAPS and his CAR R to the outside, edging past Jeff Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: What the hell? I’ve never seen that move!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Special unlocking code from Japan. Very hard to obtain. And even harder to execute. Jeff Gordon's CREW CHIEF steps up.  84.

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: Tires are low, J.G., pull her in! Jeff Gordon's steers the car into the pit. He hands the controller to the Crew Chief. His Pit Crew crowds around the controller, inputting repa Hutch calls out to Warburton...

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: We've got an eighth of a tank. Hold her for another lap! Jeff Gordon slams down a beer.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: (to his crew) LET'S GO! LET’S GO! Teddy watches Gordon’s pit crew. Notices something.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Hey! They’re using illegal cheats to increase horsepower!

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: No we’re not! Crew Chief PUSHES Teddy. He falls into Warburton.

dialogues.speaker: NOT COOL, CHIEF
dialogues.text: Warburton PUSHES Crew Chief back, harder. He FALLS into J Gordon who spills his beer all over himself. Hutch stands up, still focused on the racing.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Everybody chill out! Okay? Jeff Gordon is drenched with beer...and really pissed. He winds up and throws a PUNCH at Warburton...but MISSES and CONNECTS with Riley’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: FRIGGIN’ NOSE!  85. Hutch drops his controller and TACKLES Jeff Gordon. IT TU INTO AN ALL OUT BRAWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s the big day for the new ideas. Bracken and Hutch, wi cut above his eye from the Jeff Gordon fight, listen as Pittman and his team, dressed in WEASEL costumes, finish their marketing presentation.

dialogues.speaker: PITTMAN
dialogues.text: ...Weayaya The Weasel will be the new face of Hibrau. He’s fun, mischievous and most importantly, loves Hibrau beer.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Weayaya?

dialogues.speaker: PITTMAN
dialogues.text: It’s Native American. Sioux. It means, “The Setting Sun.” Everyone is confused.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I actually kind of like it. Has some great subliminal messages.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: If you like it, Hutch, I like it. Well done, Pittman. ACROSS THE ROOM Harvey and Phil wait their turn.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have stuck with the Badger thing.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Little S.0.B did that on purpose. (confident) Don’t worry, we’re going to blow everyone out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Okay, who’s next? Harvey and Phil gather up their stack of presentation boa  86.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Today we’re going to present to you the next generation in Hibrau marketing. Although our budget is limited, Phil and I have been able to secure a sponsorship deal that will put the Hibrau name in front of millions of potential new customers in an arena that up ‘till now has only been accessible to the big boys at Miller and Budweiser. Harvey holds up a poster board showing a pack of NASCAR c racing around track. He gives Hutch an “I gotcha now” smi

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: These “supercharged billboards” race each week at tracks around the country and are amongst the highest rated events in sports television. Phil hands him another poster board.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Through savvy negotiations, we have secured a deal with NASCAR superstar, Mark Martin! Harvey turns over the poster board that shows the Mark Ma racing car.

dialogues.speaker: EXECUTIVE
dialogues.text: Uh, his car has a big tiger on it and says “Frosted Flakes”.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Phil, next board please. Phil displays a board with a close up of the front quarte panel of the Kellogg’s car filled with a bunch of TINY DE including a Hibrau.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (pointing to the picture) See, here we are, to the left of the Beef Jerky sticker, above the Ritz Crackers and between the Winston Lights and Purina Cat Chow. Harvey looks proudly toward Bracken.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: This is where we want to be, sir.  87.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Hutch, we discussed this. You still feel strongly about it?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (whispers to Phil) Let’s see the little S.0.B. get out of this one.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I do, sir. 100%.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Good work, gentlemen-

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And I don’t want to step on any toes but as coincidence would have it, I had the opportunity to put together a little NASCAR deal as well. Hutch walks over to the door and opens it. In walks a black-eyed JEFF GORDON, DRESSED IN A LEATHER HIBRAU RACING SUIT. He’s accompanied by a bruised up Tedd Riley and Warburton sporting “Hibrau Racing Team" swag.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: “Hibrau, the number one choice of real NASCAR fans.” The jaws in the room are all on the floor. Harvey’s nut s is there as well.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Through creative deal making and, more importantly, some kind of freakish brotherly bond born out of barbaric male-bonding, my man Gordo here has agreed to become part of the Hibrau family. Hutch presents a mini scale model of the new HIBRAU RACIN CAR. The room APPLAUDS. Harvey is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: It’s an honor to be part of this exciting opportunity. Racing cars and working with guys like Hutch is what life is all about. Hutch gives him a hug.  88.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Thanks, Gordo. Sorry again about the shiner.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF GORDON
dialogues.text: It’s all good, brother.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Bravo! Hutch acknowledges Teddy, Riley and Warburton.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: My guys here know the world of NASCAR better than anyone I know. With your approval, Arthur, I’d like them to head up the team.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Brilliant!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And we can incorporate Weayaya The Weasel into the marketing.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: I love it! All of it! The room gives a standing ovation as the guys pass out th mini-model Hibrau racing cars. Harvey is melting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey has a crazed look in his eye as he stares at the m model Hibrau car on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (talking to the car) You think you’re so great, don’t you? He gently pushes the car around the desk like a ten year-

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: All shiny and fast...and full of great ideas...VROOM, VROOM. (being the voice of the car) Look at me, I’m perfect! Harvey moves the car around a paperweight then over a sta of post-it notes.  89.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I can do anything I want. He guides the car toward his stapler.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Oh, look. There’s a giant stapler in the middle of the track...No problem, I'll just go over it....Here I go over the stapler because I’m the greatest... With his other hand he picks up the stapler AND SMASHES T MODEL CAR INTO A 100 PIECES.

dialogues.speaker: ARE WE
dialogues.text: There’s a KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Harvey snaps back to reality

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Just a sec. He quickly cleans up the destroyed car. Gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Okay, come in. The door opens and in marches Sargent Heinrick from secur

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: Guten tag, Mr. Hutchinson. Heinrick looks down at his note pad.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: Hutchinson. You related to Hutch Hutchinson, the genius man-child?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Yes. Kind of busy here.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: As you know, we are in the thick of our ongoing investigation to expose this worthless excuse for a human being that exterminated Mr. Bracken’s Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: As I said, I’m busy. What do you want from me?  90. Heinrick scans his notes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: I have an eye witness claiming they saw you exit the building quote, “In a frenzy”, the day of the incident.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I've worked at Hibrau for twenty- five years. Everyday feels like a frenzy. Now, if you’1l excuse me, Sargent, I’ve got work to do. Heinrick gives him a long stare then turns for the door. He sees something on the floor and bends down to grab it. It’s a WHEEL from the Hibrau model car. He turns to Harve

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: I’ve got my eye on you, Hutchinson. He pockets the wheel and is out the door. Harvey slams hi head down on the desk. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter has come. The snow falls on a huge Christmas tree front of the main building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holiday decorations are everywhere. Angela’s at her desk working Hutch’s calls.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Happy holidays, Hutch Hutchinson's office...Please hold...Hutch Hutchinson’s office... INT. HUTCH’S OFFICE - DAY Hutch, stressed out, stands behind his desk juggling call reviewing reports, etc. Teddy and Riley are kicked back on the couch. Warburton i putting golf balls.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (into phone) That’s not gonna fly. The holidays are around the corner. Get on it! He disconnects then yells out to Angela.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Angela, I need the year-end employee review schedule!

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coming! Hutch rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dude, you need to chill.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Chill? I need to chill? I don’t have time to chill, or sleep or anything. Holiday sales are flat, this crappy weather has distribution way behind and I've got employee year-end reviews coming out of my ass.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Like I said, you need to chill. Angela comes in with the folder.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Here you go. The guys check out her ass as she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You guys are pigs.

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And are we on track with the NASCAR stuff?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Yup? What the hell is yup?  92.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: It means yes. Seriously Hutch, you’re going to have a heart attack. He plops on the couch between ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I know. I’m really stressed. The only thing that used to stress me out was running out of weed. Warburton puts his arm around him. He does. They file

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: It’s all good, guy. Take a breath.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You guys coming to the company Christmas party next week?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Smart ass punks. Get out of my office. out.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Remember who loves you, Hutch. INT. HIBRAU BREWING CO. - HUTCH’S OFFICE - DAY Hutch is all business as he gives Harvey his year-end rev Harvey looks worn, beaten down, the life sucked out of hi

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Not a terribly productive fourth quarter. What’s going on, Harv? Harvey just stares off.  93.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Huh? Did you say something?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’ve put you on the Winter Brew campaign and you've given me very little. Your lack of effort is hurting sales.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (lifeless) I‘1l get on it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What happened to your enthusiasm? Your love for this company?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Whatever. I’11 work on it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Harvey, you need to pull it together.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I heard you. Can you please stop harassing me about everything.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Bracken is riding my ass like nobody's business. Now get your act together or there’s going to be consequences.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Consequences?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: For starters, I’m holding your year- end bonus until things improve. Harvey stares at Hutch, “Are you joking?”

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Now get out there and get to work. There’s still a few hours before the Christmas party. Make the most of them.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company Christmas party in full swing. Employees eat, drink and be merry. Harvey and Phil stand by the punch bowl that sits at the of a long buffet table. Harvey is fuming.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Can you believe it? My own flesh and blood gives me a bad year-end review!

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Well, my review went great. Harvey shoots him a look then chugs his punch.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: At least we got a nice bonus.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You got a bonus?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: (back peddling) I can’t remember. Harvey chugs another glass of punch. He spots Hutch and T across the room laughing it up with a couple of secretari

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That little bastard.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (to a secretary) Ask Teddy here. I’ve always had this freaky business sense.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dude, the only business sense you had was getting out of the way when you puked all over yourself. Hutch elbows him.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: He’s just kidding around. Right, Teddy?  95.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: No. Hutch SMASHES his heel down on Teddy’s toe.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Will you ladies excuse us? Hutch pulls Teddy aside.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Um, getting wasted at a Christmas party and trying to bag that red headed chick.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You can’t say that kind of stuff around the employees. I need to maintain an authoritative persona.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Did you just say, “authoritative persona”, or was that some other asshole?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m under a lot of pressure. (beat) I’m sorry, okay?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Just lighten up and have fun. Can you still do that?

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The band stops playing and Bracken takes the mike.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Welcome everybody to the annual Hibrau holiday party! Everyone claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every year we have a talent competition, and this year is no exception. So whoever has on their dancing shoes and wants to win some fantastic prizes, waltz yourself out to the dance floor! Teddy grabs Hutch. Raises his arm.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Hutch is in! The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Dude, you said you could still have fun. So here you go.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: No, I’m not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hutch reluctantly gives in.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I’m in. HARVEY, who continues to pound the punch, lights up.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Phil, hold my jacket.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: He stole my promotion, took my position at short stop and held my bonus, but he ain’t takin’ this one. Opportunity knocks, Phil. Hutch is finally going down! Harvey chugs the rest of his drink and stumbles to the da floor. He gets right up in Hutch’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was weird. Hutch grabs Harvey. Pulls him in so no one can hear.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Did you hear the man? He said dance contest. You’re going to embarrass yourself. Take a seat-

dialogues.speaker: OH, LOOK, EVERYONE. MR. BIG TIME
dialogues.text: VICE PRESIDENT IS SCARED HE’S GOING

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Stop it, will you? Harvey clucks around like a chicken. Hutch has had enough

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Fine. Let’s do this. The MUSIC starts. They walk in a circle sizing each other Harvey eases in to an 80’s dance grove then transitions i Michael Jackson’s THRILLER. Hutch is completely surprised Harvey's dancing ability.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s right. Your old man here has got some moves! Harvey stops on a dime and SPANKS HIS ASS AT HUTCH. The c loves it. Hutch signals the band to up the beat. He moves out to th middle of the floor and busts out a sick B-boy routine. Harvey and Hutch battle back and forth: BREAKIN’, SALSA, RIVER DANCE, MACARENA, HAVA NAGILA. The crowd cheers them Harvey motions for the crowd to back up to give him room. winks over to the band and they start playing, “YOU SHOUL DANCING”, by the Bee Gee's. Harvey pulls off a perfect, move-by-move dance sequence o the famous Travolta solo dance scene from “SATURDAY NIGHT FEVER". It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentleman, we have a winner! The crowd goes nuts. Hutch goes to shake Harvey’s hand.  98.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Good win. Really impressed- Harvey pulls his hand away. Flails around like a mad man. Trash talking.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Easy, Harv.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: EASY LIKE SUNDAY MORNING. THAT’S

dialogues.speaker: HOW I BEAT YOU, MR. VICE PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Harvey continues to bounce around and trash talk...

dialogues.speaker: BUT HE LOSES CONTROL AND BUSTS A MOVE INTO THE BUFFET TAB
dialogues.text: taking out the table legs. Like a row of dominos, one-by- the trays full of food CRASH to the floor, ending with a smashing punch bowl finale, drenching Harvey. The room is silent. Bracken walks over to Harvey and hand him his prize.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the win. Harvey looks at the prize. It’s a HIBRAU RACING TEAM t-sh A few CLAPS from the crowd then everyone goes back to drinking and mingling. Harvey crawls off through the buffet slop, already forgot

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey braces himself from the frigid cold and shuffles toward the snow filled parking lot, a broken man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s early in the morning and Angela is the first one in. makes her way to her desk. She flips the page on her calender to the NEW YEAR then h into Hutch’s office.  99. INT. HUTCH’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Angela enters and flips the lights on. HUTCH IS FACE DOWN THE FLOOR. She rushes over to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: Hutch! Are you okay? He wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Huh? Yeah. Hey, Angela. I must have fallen asleep. I haven't been home in two days.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Sales were way off over Christmas and Bracken blew his load. I’ve been working all week. How was Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: It was fine. Got to see the family and eat like a pig.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: How was your Christmas?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I spent it at Taco Bell.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I got in another fight with my dad.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: You need to work things out with him, Hutch.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I can’t deal with it right now. I have too much work to do.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bracken rants around the room like a rabid dog. Hutch key on Harvey who looks like a shell of his former self.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: It was our worst holiday season in years. I don’t want to hear excuses! If you’re not performing, you're gone. That goes for all of you! Harvey just stares off into space. Hutch knows it’s only matter of time until Harvey gets the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting has broken up. Harvey passes Hutch as he exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hey. But Harvey’s in another world. He walks past without a wo

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Good to see you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch inspects the paint job on the new Hibrau racing car with Teddy, Warburton and Riley. He’s really stressed.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: The hood logo is not big enough. I told you guys, quarter panel to quarter panel.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: It’s just a mock up. We’1ll adjust it.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: And the green color is not right. It looks like frickin’ Lucky Charms. What the hell, guys?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: We can change it. Season doesn’t start for a few more weeks. We have plenty of time.  101.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That your lame excuse?

dialogues.speaker: WARBURTON
dialogues.text: Calm down, man.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Don’t “man” me! This is not acceptable! It’s going to be my ass if this isn’t right.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: You better remember who you’re talking to, Hutch. We’re not your little patsies at the office.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What you guys are is complete screw ups! I hand you the dream job of a lifetime and you can’t even get the simple stuff straight. He stares at Teddy waiting for a response.

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: Hutch, go screw yourself, you douche bag. Teddy turns and walks out. Warburton follows.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That’s real mature. He turns to Riley.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Those numb nuts don’t realize what a good thing they have.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Neither do you, Hutch. Riley heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Screw you guys! You’re dead weight anyway! Hutch gathers himself. He takes a deep breath trying to c down. He looks over at the car.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It’s the wrong shade of green.  102. He SCREAMS then punches the air. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT Hutch is on the couch reviewing sales reports. There’s a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: Annoyed, he goes to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mom? Marilyn balances a stack of Tupperware.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: I hope you’re hungry. I brought leftovers.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You didn’t have to do that. She looks around at the fast food wrappers, pizza boxes a empty Red Bull cans scattered around the loft.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Yes, I did. Now invite me in before I drop the Tupperware. Hutch grabs the stack and leads her over to the couch. Sh notices the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Looks like they have you working pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You wouldn't believe it. (beat) But I got it handled.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: You sound like your dad.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Funny one.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: I’m not joking, Hutch.  103. Hutch takes a moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: How’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: I think he misses you.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Yeah, misses telling me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: He really does, Hutch. And deep down inside, he’s incredibly proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: He’s got a funny way of showing it.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: He’s going through a weird time right now. (beat) I’m not telling you what to do, but despite his faults, your dad has always been there for you. Make an effort, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch gathers himself then KNOCKS on Harvey’s office door

dialogues.speaker: PHIL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He’s not here, Hutch. Hutch turns to see Phil behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hey, Phil. Is my dad at lunch?

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: He didn't come in. Took a sick day.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: A sick day? I don’t think he’s ever taken a sick day. Is he sick? Phil leans in.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Between you and me, I think he’s just sick of coming in.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marilyn serves Harvey some lunch.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Okay, Harv. I’ve got to go show a house. You going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’m fine. (beat) Are things going well?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Is what going well?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Your career. Is your career going well? She looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: It’s going great. Thanks for asking.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Where’s the showing?

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Over on Maple. Three bedroom craftsman.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Knock ‘em dead.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Thanks, Harvey. She gives him a kiss and heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey enters the living room where Nicole is working on video project.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Hey dad, how come there’s hardly any video from the last few years? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s tons of footage from when you and Mom first got married and when we were little kids, but it’s pretty thin after that. Why did you stop filming stuff? This hits Harvey hard. He doesn’t know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: It’s cool, Dad. I’11 make it work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey comes upstairs to call it a night. He stops in fro of Hutch’s old bedroom, then goes in. INT. HUTCH’S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS Rachael Ray lays on the bed, totally depressed. Harvey looks around the sterilized room. The energy of Hu has been cleaned away. Harvey has a moment. Then... Begins MESSING UP THE room. Unmaking the bed, tossing PlayStation games and magazines. He opens the drawers and unloads socks and underwear onto the floor. He looks around, grins.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s better. Rachael Ray BARKS in agreement. Harvey turns to walk out. Marilyn stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: Quit being a stubborn ass and go talk to him. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - NIGHT A KNOCK on the door. Hutch opens it, revealing Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (uncomfortable) Hey, Hutch.  106.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (more uncomfortable) I thought you were the pizza guy. Come on in. Harvey enters the loft.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Wow. Nice place.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It’s fine. I’m not really here that much.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Long hours at work, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Like 24-7. They head over to the couch. Harvey notices a pile of crumpled up paper on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: What are you working on?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Bracken’s riding my ass for new product ideas. He doesn’t let up.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Got anything?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Not yet. Unless neon colored beer sounds like a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’ve heard better. (beat) Do you have a minute to talk?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Sure. They sit. Hutch tears a Red Bull out of a case on the flo

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Drink? Harvey waves it off. Hutch opens one for himself.  107.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You sure? Drink this stuff and you can stay up for a week.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You have any beer?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Do I have any beer? Hutch goes to the fridge and grabs a six pack of Hibrau. heads back to the couch and hands a beer to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Join me? Hutch is suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: This feels like some kind of set- up. Thought I couldn't drink in front of you?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That’s when you were just a dumb ass kid. Open one for yourself, will ya? Hutch opens one. Harvey holds up his can.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: A toast. To my son...and boss, Hutch Hutchinson, who’s not only smart and a hard worker, but has proven that there’s not just one path to success. I’m really proud of you and I’m sorry it’s taken me so long to tell you. (beat) More importantly, I want you to know that having you in my life and spending time with the family is more important than any promotion. Hutch is touched. Holds up his can.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I’1l drink to that. (beat) And to Harvey Hutchinson. One hell of an S.O.B. who taught me everything I know. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And even though he’s made my life hell for the past twenty years, I wouldn't trade him for a million stock options. (beat) And I’m sorry if I give you too much of your own medicine.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Fair enough. I’11 drink to that. They clink cans. Hutch chugs his beer then crushes the ca against his head. Harvey looks at Hutch like he’s nuts. Then Harvey chugs h beer and crushes the can like Hutch. They both crack up. INT. HUTCH’S LOFT - LATER Empty beer cans litter the coffee table. Hutch and Harvey pretty buzzed. They laugh it up and tell stories, bonding

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well when I was a senior in High School I got caught with a girl in the locker room.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: She was my Spanish teacher.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Nice!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell your mother.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Well, once Teddy and I broke into a house and stole their new Sony plasma. We pawned it to get tickets for a Bucks game.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What? You said I could tell you anything.  109.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Oops. We were pretty messed up that night. Sorry. Harvey lets it go. They share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Okay. If I tell you this next thing you have to swear you will never tell anybody.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: (crosses himself) On the hot Asian weather chick from CNN.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I was the one who busted up Bracken’s Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Oh yes, I did. The day you got the promotion. It was sort of an accident. Hutch toasts him.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: You, my pops, are the king of kings! Harvey grabs for his beer but MISTAKENLY PICKS UP A RED B AND TAKES A BIG SWIG. He perks up.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Whoa! What’s in this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I don’t know. All sorts of crap. (reading the can) “Red Bull vitalizes the body and mind." Harvey chugs some more as a light bulb flickers in his he

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You know what would be an interesting idea?  110.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Taking this father son bonding thing to the next level and calling over some hookers?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: No. Check this out. Harvey holds up a can of Hibrau and a can of Red Bull

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (with a grin) Hibrau energy beer.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Genius!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Bet that stuff would sell, huh?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Like naked pictures of Vanessa Hudgens. Hutch grabs a note pad off the coffee table. They start t riff on the idea.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY AND HUTCH WORK ON THE ENERGY BEER IDEA
dialogues.text: -- Late night in Harvey's office, they work on the concep Harvey's got his motivation back. -- Harvey and Hutch taste energy beer samples with the Br Master. -- Harvey shows Hutch a mock up of the energy beer can. H loves it. -- Hutch has reconciled with his boys. Consults with them the energy beer concept. -- Hutch and Harvey play PlayStation in Hutch’s loft, finalizing ideas and laughing it up. Father and son are a peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Hutch practice the energy beer presentation to Marilyn and Nicole.  111.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: And that, ladies and gentleman, is the all new Hibrau Energy Beer. Hutch holds up the mock up can.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: “Hibrau Energy Beer -- Have a blast!". Marilyn and Nicole love it. They APPLAUD.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you! Harvey grabs something from under the table. It’s a BRAND VIDEO CAMERA. He hands it to Nicole.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: How about we go through it again and you can film it. Maybe use the footage for your project.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE
dialogues.text: Awesome. Thanks, Dad. She fires up the camera and they go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Hutch stand outside the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: You ready to do this?

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It’s on.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Like Donkey Kong.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Just go with it. They bump fists.  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch and Harvey give their presentation to Bracken and t Execs.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It’s a revolutionary new product that could double Hibrau’s market share within six months. This man next to me, Harvey Hutchinson, is the brain child behind this incredible idea. Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Hutch. What I’m about to present here combines- THE DOOR OPENS and IN WALKS SARGENT HEINRICK. He carries file folder.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Sargent Heinrick, we’re in the middle of a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HEINRICK
dialogues.text: I’ve solved it, sir. We found the scum that exterminated your Bentley, sir. He opens the file folder and tosses out GRAINY PHOTOS OF HARVEY AT THE SCENE OF THE CRIME.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: (sotto) Crap. Bracken looks at the photos then to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: An inside job. I’m disappointed in you, Hutchinson.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Bracken, it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Sargent Heinrick, arrest this man!

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: But- Sargent Heinrick pulls out the cuffs.  113.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Sir, please let me explain?

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Make it quick.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I've worked at Hibrau for twenty- five years and I've put my heart and soul into this place. Sometimes at the cost of my own family. The day I accidently wrecked your car was a very emotional time for me. I know I should have come forward earlier, but I didn't, and that was a mistake. I truly apologize, sir. Bracken contemplates...

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Arrest him, Sargent Heinrick, and he’s fired. Get this man out of my face. Heinrick approaches Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: I’1l1 leave on my own, thank you. (to Bracken) And for the record, I quit! Harvey walks to the door with his head held high.

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: Hutch, can we get on with it? What’s this great idea? Hutch looks over to Harvey, then back to Bracken.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Well Mr. Bracken, the great idea is that...you can go fuck yourself. Harvey can’t believe what Hutch just did. But he loves it

dialogues.speaker: BRACKEN
dialogues.text: How dare you! You’1ll never work in this business as long as I live!

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Let’s hope that won’t be too long. Hutch walks over to Harvey who stands at the door.  114.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: How ‘bout we get the hell out of this dump, “Dad”?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: That sounds like a great idea, “Son”. As they head out the door they both turn around and FLIP BRACKEN. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole family is gathered around the television, eatin pizza and watching Nicole’s completed video project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Hutch and Harvey practicing the presentation the d Harvey gave Nicole the camera.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...then my dad and my brother come up with this amazing idea for the company they work at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch and Harvey are in the DRIVEWAY the day of the Hibra presentation. Marilyn wishes them good luck. Harvey's about to get into the passenger seat of Hutch’s Benz. Hutch whistles to him, then tosses Harvey the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch and Harvey arrive home after getting fired.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Not quite as planned. We got fired.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: What? Oh, no-  115.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: It was awesome! And we took the bus home. Harvey grabs Marilyn. Plants her with a passionate kiss.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Let’s celebrate. Dinner wherever you guys want! Marilyn looks over at Nicole who’s filming and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think they’ve gone insane.

dialogues.speaker: MARILYN
dialogues.text: I kind of like it. She grabs Harvey and kisses him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch and Harvey are working intently.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Both Dad and Hutch are out of work but they’re like really stoked and acting weird, working on some secret project.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey and Hutch take a break from working and play hocke with golf clubs. Harvey scores a goal on Hutch and lifts club in the air.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But they were having fun and acting like idiots as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage has been transformed into a real work space. H and Harvey address their STAFF which includes Teddy, Warburton, Riley, Angela and Phil.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Thanks to all of your hard work, Hutch and I are proud to present... Hutch reaches into a box and pulls out a can of...  116.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Hutchinson Energy Beer! Everyone applauds. Hutch breaks open the box and passes o the cans. He hands one to Harvey. Nicole ZOOMS IN ON THE CANS as Hutch and Harvey toast. She ZOOMS OUT to revel that we are now in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hutch and Harvey stand together in the small brewery.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY /HUTCH
dialogues.text: Cheers! The staff has gotten larger. They all raise their cans.

dialogues.speaker: STAFF
dialogues.text: Cheers!

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was pretty amazing what they pulled off. Hutch turns to Harvey.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: Okay, so you sure you can handle this on your own?

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Very funny. Hutch scoops up his book bag.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: I‘’1l be back after my marketing exam.

dialogues.speaker: HARVEY
dialogues.text: Pass it or you’re fired.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCH
dialogues.text: That’s the old Harv I love. Hutch and Teddy take off as Harvey celebrates with the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harvey, Marilyn, Hutch and Rachael Ray hang out.  117.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Things were going great for the Hutchinsons. In addition to the brewery, Dad was at peace, Hutch was in school, Mom had her family back and I finally finished this project. Nicole joins the family in front of the camera. Wrangles to pose for a final shot.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that is the story of the Hutchinsons. It’s not all pretty, but it’s all true.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The family applauds. Rachael Ray BARKS her support...Then SNATCHES the pizza box and dashes toward the stairs. The Hutchinson’s laugh it up as they scramble after her. FADE OUT.
